description.short: an OSC message with address and arguments

methods.name: addBlobArg
methods.short: add a binary blog

methods.name: addBoolArg
methods.short: add a bool true sends a OFXOSC_TYPE_TRUE & false sends a OFXOSC_TYPE_FALSE

methods.name: addCharArg
methods.short: add a char

methods.name: addDoubleArg
methods.short: add a 64-bit double

methods.name: addFloatArg
methods.short: add a 32-bit float

methods.name: addImpulseArg
methods.short: add a trigger impulse (has no value) alias for addTriggerArg()

methods.name: addInfinitumArg
methods.short: add a trigger impulse (has no value) alias for addTriggerArg()

methods.name: addInt32Arg
methods.short: add a 32-bit integer

methods.name: addInt64Arg
methods.short: add a 64-bit integer

methods.name: addIntArg
methods.short: add a 32-bit integer

methods.name: addMidiMessageArg
methods.short: add a 4-byte MIDI message

methods.name: addNoneArg
methods.short: add a none/nil (has no value)

methods.name: addRgbaColorArg
methods.short: add a 32-bit color

methods.name: addStringArg
methods.short: add a string

methods.name: addSymbolArg
methods.short: add a symbol (string)

methods.name: addTimetagArg
methods.short: add a 64-bit NTP time tag

methods.name: addTriggerArg
methods.short: add a trigger impulse (has no value)

methods.name: clear
methods.short: clear this message

methods.name: copy
methods.short: for operator= and copy constructor

methods.name: getAddress
methods.short: \return the OSC address

methods.name: getArgAsBlob
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument as a binary blob

methods.name: getArgAsBool
methods.short:
get argument as a bool, converts numeric types automatically this argument type matches both OFXOSC_TYPE_TRUE & OFXOSC_TYPE_FALSE

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a bool

methods.name: getArgAsChar
methods.short:
get argument as a string, converts numeric types with a warning

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a string

methods.name: getArgAsDouble
methods.short:
get argument as a double, converts numeric types automatically

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a double

methods.name: getArgAsFloat
methods.short:
get argument as a float, converts numeric types automatically prints a warning when converting higher precision types

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a float

methods.name: getArgAsImpulse
methods.short:
get argument as a trigger impulse this is an alias for getArgAsTrigger()

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return true if argument was a trigger

methods.name: getArgAsInfinitum
methods.short:
get argument as a trigger impulse this is an alias for getArgAsTrigger()

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return true if argument was a trigger

methods.name: getArgAsInt
methods.short:
get argument as an integer, converts numeric types automatically prints a warning when converting higher precision types

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a 32-bit int

methods.name: getArgAsInt32
methods.short:
get argument as an integer, converts numeric types automatically prints a warning when converting higher precision types

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a 32-bit int

methods.name: getArgAsInt64
methods.short:
get argument as a 64-bit integer, converts numeric types automatically \return given argument value as a 64-bit int

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item.

methods.name: getArgAsMidiMessage
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a 4-byte midi message

methods.name: getArgAsNone
methods.short:
get argument as a none/nil

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return true if argument was a none/nil

methods.name: getArgAsRgbaColor
methods.short:
get an argument as an RGBA color, converts int32 automatically

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument as a 32-bit color value

methods.name: getArgAsString
methods.short:
get argument as a string, converts numeric types with a warning

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a string

methods.name: getArgAsSymbol
methods.short:
get argument as a symbol (string), converts numeric types with a warning

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument value as a symbol (string)

methods.name: getArgAsTimetag
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return given argument as a 64-bit NTP time tag

methods.name: getArgAsTrigger
methods.short:
get argument as a trigger impulse

Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return true if argument was a trigger

methods.name: getArgType
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return argument type code for a given index

methods.name: getArgTypeName
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return argument type tag char as a string

methods.name: getNumArgs
methods.short: \return number of arguments

methods.name: getRemoteHost
methods.short: \return the remote host name/ip or "" if not set

methods.name: getRemotePort
methods.short: \return the remote port or 0 if not set

methods.name: getTypeString
methods.short:
Parameters:

index The index of the queried item. \return type tags for all arguments as a string, 1 char for each argument

methods.name: setAddress
methods.short: set the message address, must start with a /

methods.name: setRemoteEndpoint
methods.parameters: const string &host, int port
methods.short: set host and port of the remote endpoint, this is mainly used by ofxOscReceiver

methods.name: address
methods.short: < OSC address, must start with a /

methods.name: args
methods.short: < current arguments

methods.name: remoteHost
methods.short: < host name/ip the message was sent from

methods.name: remotePort
methods.short: < port the message was sent from
